attributes.action: clarify the British Government position on the payment of bribes to insurgents in Afghanistan in the hope that they will stop fighting.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Times of 25 January 2010 reported that the British Government amongst others has agreed to bribes payable to the Taliban in order to dissuade them from fighting British and other NATO countries currently occupying their country.  I had always understood that the British Government position was never to pay bribes.  I require the British Government to make it's position clear about bribes in general and to explain why it appears to be acceptable in Afghanistan?
